page.title: 05RECREATION.
page.content:
Etherow Country Park Wardens.
We went to the Country Park and walked around the lake. When we got back to the Visitor's Centre we met Mr. Fernley, the Chief Warden and Tony one of the Park Wardens. We found out that the wardens must have some knowledge of Nature, trees, birds and animals. Most of the wardens work far more than the 37 hours required.Tony starts at 7-50 a.m. and can still be working late at night. Tony is there to help people and to look out for people misbehaving. For instance, fishermen fishing in the wrong places. There are about 1/4 million visitors each year and there are several full-time wardens and 21 part-time helpers to assist them.
